channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI Honeymoon Is Over for Chip Equipment Industry
item.description: This week brought a reckoning as ASML’s disappointing results revealed an uneven market.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise to New Record on Sliding Treasury Yields, China Demand
item.description: Gold futures rise 0.5% to $2,705.10 a troy ounce, having peaked at a new record of $2,712.70 in late European trading.

item.title: A Wyoming Couple Are Tired of Being Landlords. They Need a New Financial Plan.
item.description: Amy Nagler and Ranie Lynds own seven homes worth nearly $2 million. A financial adviser offers some suggestions for diversifying.

item.title: Vistra’s stock has quadrupled in a year. Here’s why it’s not too late to buy.

item.title: U.S. Data Spark Bigger Euro Reaction Than ECB Decision
item.description: The euro was little moved by the European Central Bank’s 25 basis-point interest-rate cut on Thursday but improved U.S. economic data sparked a bigger...

item.title: I’m 63, retired and getting $45,000 per year. But I only have about $200,000 in my IRA and still have a mortgage. What’s my move?
item.description: Have an issue with your financial adviser or considering a new one? Email questions or concerns to picks@marketwatch.com.

item.title: ‘A disappointment to home buyers’: Mortgage rates surge to a two-month high
item.description: The 30-year mortgage rate is averaging 6.44%, Freddie Mac said in its latest weekly survey on Thursday.

item.title: Trump and Harris would add trillions to the national debt. Here’s why it could lead to higher costs for households.

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Fall Unexpectedly
